alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Early; Grady; Miller; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 14 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama, Florida and southwest Georgia, including the following areas, in southeast Alabama, Coffee, Dale, Geneva, Henry and Houston. In Florida, Calhoun, Central Walton, Coastal Bay, Coastal Franklin, Coastal Gulf, Coastal Wakulla, Gadsden, Holmes, Inland Bay, Inland Franklin, Inland Gulf, Inland Wakulla, Jackson, Leon, Liberty, North Walton, South Walton and Washington. In southwest Georgia, Decatur, Early, Grady, Miller and Seminole. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Occasional pockets of heavy rainfall are expected to continue through Saturday, and saturated conditions could lead to instances of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
